content: @Brock Whittaker recently did a bunch of work fixing rough edges in our mobile web experience around sidebars/settings/etc, recently deployed here. It'd be awesome if a few folks tested it out. One thing that we're still playing with is the scrolling/reply experience; right now we're experimenting with long-press-to-reply.
I just tried out mobile web on my iPhone, and it seems to be working well.

User list scrolling is a great improvement.
There seems to be a regression in the message list scrolling. If I scroll slowly it automatically opens the compose box which makes scrolling very difficult. It was working fine before today's changes.
Tested on chrome on android(Chrome version: 59.0.3071.125).
Interesting @Harshit Bansal! @Brock Whittaker I think we might want to check if the touchstart and touchend events have had some scrolling in between before opening the long-press menu.
